result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Thomas Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
DNA Sample.

*Amended to reflect the correct repeater enhancer*

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF60, 16CF223, 18CF93 and 18CF195 @ 11:38 a.m. Sentencing after revocation on 16CF60 and 16CF223. Agreement reached on all. 18CF195 - State moves to dri both counts. 18CF93 - Def will plead to charge, prelim will be waived, information filed electronically.
16CF60 and 16CF223 - State has reviewed revocation packet, no additions or corrections. 16CF60 credit for 198 days. 16CF223 credit for 130 days. Recommendation on all three is for 5 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 3 yrs es, concurrent to each other. If 18CF93 is run concurrent to those, 125 days credit. State has complied with VWNR in 18CF195. Atty Debord and Def agree.
Court reviews prelim hrg rights w/Def. Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary in both 18CF93 and 18CF195, finds probable cause and binds over. Copy of information in 18CF93 received, reading waived. Plea quest. reviewed. 18CF93 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 18CF195 cts 1 & 2. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Debord satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds Def guilty of 18CF93. Sentencing remarks by counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 18CF93 ct 1 - 5 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 3 yrs es, credit for 125 days served, court costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file. Def eligible for SAP and CIP. 16CF60 ct 1 - 5 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 3 yrs es, concurrent to 18CF93, credit for 198 days served. 16CF223 ct 1 - 5 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 3 yrs es, credit for 130 days served. Def eligible for SAP and CIP on all. All are concurrent with each other. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights. (Verified with Judge - costs to be paid through extended supervision)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 26, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court, in custody with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF60, 16CF125, & 16CF223  @ 10:00 am.  State gives plea agreement, 16CF60 plea to ct 1, 16CF223 ct 1 & ct 3, 16CF125 DRI, and remaining charge 16CF223 in ct 2.  16CF60 Ct 1 & 16CF2233 Ct 1withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA & follow through, costs, DNA Sample ct 3 80 days jail, costs,  DNA sample.  17 days credit.  16CF60 1 day credit if revoked.  16CF223 Ct 1 credit 17 days if revoked.  16CF125 8 days credit to be given 16CF60.  Defense can argue to be applied to 16CF223.  Atty Siehr gives argument.  Court will apply credit in 16CF60 from 16CF125.  Waiver of preliminary examination 16CF60 & 16CF223.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over on 16CF60 & 16CF223. Informations Filed.  Atty Siehr has copy of informations and waives reading.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF60 Mnf/Deliver Meth, ct 1 no contest plea. 16CF223 ct 1 Bailjumping, no contest, ct 3 Obstructing no contest. DRI 16CF125 & Ct 2 16CF223.  Def. advised of constitutional rights and J.T. rights.  Def. understand repeater allegations. Def. admits prior convictions. Def. understands elements.  Atty Siehr is satisfied.  Court finds plea are freely & voluntarily given.  State gives factual basis. Atty Siehr add facts for Ct 3.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds def Guilty to 16CF60 ct 1 Mnf/Deliver Meth 2nd offense and 16CF223 Ct 1 Bail jumping, repeater and Ct 3 Obstructing, repeater.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Siehr gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement. Court orders on
16CF60 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA and follow through with recommendation, costs, 250 DNA surcharge, DNA Sample. Credit 1 day if revoked. 30 days jail, huber privileges.
16CF223 ct 1 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA and follow through with recommendation, costs, 250 DNA Surcharge, Credit for 1 days if revoked. 
ct 3 80 days jail, Good Time, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, 17 days credit plus 8 days credit from 16CF223, Huber privileges.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. advised of postconviction rights. Bonds already forfeited.  16CF223 Def. given p.p on ct 3. Jail commencing today. 25 day credit on ct 3 on 16CF223.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court  via video with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF60, 15CF125 & 16CF223.  Statement by Atty Siehr.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties for case 16CF223.   Bond of $2000.00 has been set and this will cover all 3 files.  Timely preliminary  hearing explained to def.  Def agrees to waive time limits.  Case may be called tomorrow  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court, via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New complaint filed.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def can contact public defender, hire an atty or court appointed atty.  16CF60 & 16CF125, state request warrants be vacted.  Bond arguments.  State requesting $2500.00.  Response by def.  Court sets bond.  Bond will cover all three files  New complaint will be AIA  Warrant vacated.  Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker not in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 16CF60 & 16CF125.  Notices were sent for bond forfeiture hearing.  State moves to forfeit both bonds.  Court orders bonds fofeited to Langlade County

Attorney Gabriel G. Siehr in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF60 & 16CF125  @ 2:46 pm.  Atty Siehr spoke with def. and def. was told to appear in court.  State request warrant $2500 cash and bond forfeiture.  Def. has an outstanding Marathon Co. warrant. Court will forfeit pending hearing will authorize warrant $2500.00 cash to cover both case.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court, in custody & via-video with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF60 & 16CF125 @ 1:53 pm.  Atty Siehr has copy of criminal complaints, and def. advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Siehr will waive time limits. Bond already set in 16CF60.  16CF125 Court will modify to 1,000.00 cash bond. Def. waives time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Atty requested.  Def can contact public defender, hire an atty or court appointed.  Court will adjourn.  Def to appear with counsel, contact public defender or complete court appt.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Thomas Walker in court via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:04 p.m. State states charges and gives bond recommendation of $1,000.00 cash bond. Statement by Def. Def advised to contact Public Defender's Office. Statement by Def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
